column5: . Was up in the man lift all day working on a rtg. At one time, their was golf ball side sleet. The man lift swinging. . East wind to top it off.  So how was every bodies day.
You wanna try standing on top of a 100' aerial ladder Paul
Rainy Mondays are a damper...LOL But I am anticipating drier weather soon as season opener aproaches and I am about 6 hours away from settin' sail. Doing a Starcraft makeover..  Nipper
Except for the last line I don't have a clue what you just said there.  Translation anyone?
He, like me, works outdoors in bad weather sometimes.  Manlift=cherrypicker,bucket truck,snorkellift,etc  Lew, doesn't the fire your trying to put out keep you warm?

Paul was swingin around all day gettin pelted by hail !  I was running around the yard parking vehicles under wings to use as anchors and adding ratchet straps before customers aircraft took flight without starting the motors!
Gotcha. Thanks for the explanation, "Man lift" is kind of vague and could have several different meanings.
We got some wicked wind down here, my parents also had a few trees down in Coldwater.  How badly did you get it up there Wayne?  The clouds were moving awful fast..
Still blowing. I'd guess gusts to 65 K. I know the hydro chopper wasn't havin fun in it this afternoon as he flew sideways over my field at least 5 times coming and going from the yard in Penetang.
if by up there you mean as far as north bay they werent any better 40k steady and gusts to 65 according to our wind-o-meter at work!
so thats what all those 'spare' vehicles are for !   Got a little chilley on my office in the afternoon  TB
Look for a humidex of 30C this weekend.  That's it for spring in Southern Ontario, folks.
